meanings.definition: Stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or course of action.
meanings.sent1: Despite the evidence, the obdurate man insisted he was right.
meanings.sent2: She remained obdurate in her decision, ignoring all advice.
meanings.sent3: The obdurate child refused to eat his vegetables, even when offered ice cream as a reward.
meanings.sent4: Her obdurate belief in ghosts made her terrified of the dark.
meanings.sent5: The obdurate rock stood unmoved by the crashing waves, just like his stubbornness.

meanings.sent1: Years of rejection had made him obdurate to any form of affection.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's obdurate heart could not be softened by the war's horrors.
meanings.sent3: Her obdurate attitude towards love stemmed from past heartbreaks.
meanings.sent4: His obdurate emotions shielded him from further pain.
meanings.sent5: The obdurate old man rarely showed any emotion, his heart like a stone.

meanings.sent1: The obdurate criminal refused to confess, even under intense interrogation.
meanings.sent2: Her obdurate stance on the issue made compromise impossible.
meanings.sent3: The obdurate cat refused to come inside, no matter how much its owner pleaded.
meanings.sent4: His obdurate resistance to change hindered the progress of the project.
meanings.sent5: The obdurate ice cream remained solid even in the scorching sun, unmelted by the heat.
